definitions.definition: a mechanism for keeping a door, lid, etc., fastened, typically operated only by a key of a particular form.
examples: the key turned firmly in the lock

definitions.definition: a device used to prevent the operation or movement of a vehicle or other machine.
a facility on a computer or mobile phone that requires a user to verify their identity with a passcode or other form of authentication in order to access the full functionality of the device.
examples: there's a security lock on the phone and he doesn't know the code

definitions.definition: (in wrestling and martial arts) a hold that prevents an opponent from moving a limb.
a number of interlocked or jammed items.
examples: a street closed by a lock of carriages

definitions.definition: a short confined section of a canal or other waterway in which the water level can be changed by the use of gates and sluices, used for raising and lowering vessels between two gates.
an airlock.
a person or thing that is certain to succeed; a certainty.
a mechanism for exploding the charge of a gun.
fasten or secure (something) with a lock.
examples: she closed and locked her desk

definitions.definition: enclose or shut in by locking or fastening a door, lid, etc.
examples: the prisoners are locked in overnight

definitions.definition: (of a door, window, box, etc.) become or be able to be secured through activation of a lock.
examples: the door will automatically lock behind you

definitions.definition: restrict access to the full functionality or data of (a computer, mobile phone, file, etc.), especially by requiring a user to verify their identity with a passcode or other form of authentication.
examples: my computer is locked and I've forgotten my login info

definitions.definition: (of a mobile phone) operate only on the network of a particular carrier.
examples: the phone is locked to T-mobile

definitions.definition: make or become rigidly fixed or immovable.
examples: he locked his hands behind her neck

definitions.definition: go through a lock on a canal.
examples: we locked through at Moore Haven

definitions.definition: a piece of a person's hair that coils or hangs together.
examples: she pushed back a lock of hair

definitions.definition: a person's hair.
examples: flowing locks and a long white beard

definitions.definition: a tuft of wool or cotton.
short for dreadlocks.
